title: Scouser donates £200MILLION to charity in one of largest public donations in history
text:
Scouser donates £200MILLION to charity in one of largest public donations in history Generous Steve Morgan made the donation in the form of 42 million shares from his company, Redrow PLC, representing more than 11% of the shareholding Share Comments By Lucy Clarke-Billings 14:28, 16 FEB 2017 Updated 14:31, 16 FEB 2017 News Mr Morgan founded the company Redrow in 1974 and is currently its chairman (Photo: BBC) Share Comments Get daily A housebuilding tycoon has donated more than £200million to charity in what is thought to be one of the largest public donations made in the UK.
Successful businessman Steve Morgan, who once tried to buy Liverpool Football Club, set up The Morgan Foundation in 2001 to help community groups, in particular those which help children and families in desperate need.
He made the donation in the form of 42 million shares from his company, Redrow PLC, representing more than 11% of the shareholding.
Shares in the company currently cost 493p, valuing the donation at a staggering £207 million.
It is thought the donation is one of the largest ever publicly made by a Brit.
Read More Millionaire pal of David Cameron vows to transform entire village he bought despite pledge to keep it 'unspoilt' Steve Morgan has a fortune of £880 million (Photo: Redrow/PA) Redrow housing development in Kent (Photo: Gareth Fuller/PA) Jane Harris, administrator of The Morgan Foundation, said: "Steve Morgan's incredible generosity will mean a huge and profound step-change for The Morgan Foundation.
"Our ethos is based on making a difference and Steve's gift of over £200 million means we will be able to help thousands of more people in need.
"We can also ramp-up the donation of smiley buses which have made such a positive impact to the disabled and socially isolated in our region.
"I'm also delighted to say we are actively planning some very exciting, and significant, capital projects and we'll be announcing more details soon."
Mr Morgan, 64, and originally from Liverpool, has a fortune of £880 million, according to The Sunday Times.
He founded Redrow in 1974 and is currently chairman of the group.
Read More Millionaire 'haggled with hitman over killing of business partner, saying: "F**k that's a lot of money"' The housebuilder's donation will have an incredible impact on the disabled and socially isolated (Photo: Gareth Fuller/PA) The housebuilder recently announced bumper results. In the six months to December 31, 2016, they turned over a record £739 million and reported a pre-tax profits of £140 million, an increase of 35 per cent.
They also announced a dividend of 6p per share. If they report a similar amount in the next six months this will result in a dividend of around £2.5 million.
The Morgan Foundation has committed £35 million to causes over the past 16 years.
